intro: Tithymalus orphanidis, commonly known as the Cyprus tithymale, is a rare flowering plant native to Cyprus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
